item.title: single user boot for grub 2
item.description: Ubuntu changed to grub 2 and I often find myself looking up how to finagle my way into a single user shell. Step 1. Hold the right shift to display the grub menu at boot time. Step 2. Select the correct kernel, press CTRL+e to edit the boot command. Step 3. Append the two directives Single init=/bin/bash Step 4. Press CTRL+x to boot and wait for the root prompt.
